chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), E.eval bool cond e = true -> exec e p1 e' -> exec e (Iif cond p1 p2) e'

Premises:
Inductive ImpProg : Type := Iskip : ImpProg | Iset : forall A : Type, E.Var A -> E.Expr A -> ImpProg | Iif : E.Expr bool -> ImpProg -> ImpProg -> ImpProg | Iseq : ImpProg -> ImpProg -> ImpProg | Iwhile : E.Expr bool -> ImpProg -> ImpProg Arguments Iset [A]%type_scope
E.Expr = Ex.Expr : Type -> Type Arguments E.Expr _%type_scope
E.Env = Ex.Env : Type
E.eval : forall A : Type, E.Expr A -> E.Env -> A
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Module E : Sig Definition Var : Type -> Type. Definition Expr : Type -> Type. Definition Env : Type. Definition upd : forall A : Type, Var A -> A -> Env -> Env. Definition eval : forall A : Type, Expr A -> Env -> A. End := HoareLogic.E 
Inductive exec : E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env -> Prop := exec_Iskip : forall e : E.Env, exec e Iskip e | exec_Iset : forall (A : Type) (e : E.Env) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), exec e (Iset x expr) (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e) | exec_Iif : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> exec e (Iif cond p1 p2) e' | exec_Iseq : forall (e : E.Env) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' e'' : E.Env), exec e p
exec_Iif : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> exec e (Iif cond p1 p2) e'
exec_sind : forall P : E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env -> SProp, (forall e : E.Env, P e Iskip e) -> (forall (A : Type) (e : E.Env) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P e (Iset x expr) (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e)) -> (forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (Iif cond p1 p2) e') ->...-> P e i e0
exec_ind : forall P : E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env -> Prop, (forall e : E.Env, P e Iskip e) -> (forall (A : Type) (e : E.Env) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P e (Iset x expr) (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e)) -> (forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (Iif cond p1 p2) e') ->...-> P e i e0
exec_Iseq : forall (e : E.Env) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' e'' : E.Env), exec e p1 e' -> exec e' p2 e'' -> exec e (Iseq p1 p2) e''
exec_Iwhile : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), exec e (Iif cond (Iseq p (Iwhile cond p)) Iskip) e' -> exec e (Iwhile cond p) e'
ImpProg_ind : forall P : ImpProg -> Prop, P Iskip -> (forall (A : Type) (v : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P (Iset v expr)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 : ImpProg), P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iif cond p1 p2)) -> (forall p1 : ImpProg, P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iseq p1 p2)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), P p -> P (Iwhile cond p)) -> forall i : ImpProg, P i
ImpProg_rec : forall P : ImpProg -> Set, P Iskip -> (forall (A : Type) (v : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P (Iset v expr)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 : ImpProg), P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iif cond p1 p2)) -> (forall p1 : ImpProg, P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iseq p1 p2)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), P p -> P (Iwhile cond p)) -> forall i : ImpProg, P i
ImpProg_rect : forall P : ImpProg -> Type, P Iskip -> (forall (A : Type) (v : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P (Iset v expr)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 : ImpProg), P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iif cond p1 p2)) -> (forall p1 : ImpProg, P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iseq p1 p2)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), P p -> P (Iwhile cond p)) -> forall i : ImpProg, P i
ImpProg_sind : forall P : ImpProg -> SProp, P Iskip -> (forall (A : Type) (v : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P (Iset v expr)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 : ImpProg), P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iif cond p1 p2)) -> (forall p1 : ImpProg, P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iseq p1 p2)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), P p -> P (Iwhile cond p)) -> forall i : ImpProg, P i
exec_Iset : forall (A : Type) (e : E.Env) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), exec e (Iset x expr) (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e)
exec_Iskip : forall e : E.Env, exec e Iskip e
Bool.diff_false_true = fun H : false = true => let H0 : False := eq_ind false (fun e : bool => if e then False else True) I true H in False_ind False H0 : false <> true

Inductive ImpProg : Type := Iskip : ImpProg | Iset : forall A : Type, E.Var A -> E.Expr A -> ImpProg | Iif : E.Expr bool -> ImpProg -> ImpProg -> ImpProg | Iseq : ImpProg -> ImpProg -> ImpProg | Iwhile : E.Expr bool -> ImpProg -> ImpProg Arguments Iset [A]%type_scope

Iset : forall A : Type, E.Var A -> E.Expr A -> ImpProg
